channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large potholes on Chapel Lane at Commercial Street end, 13th April
item.description:
Top of Chapel Lane near entrance from Commercial Street. At the side of the dance school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Chapel Lane, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Looks like a road from a warzone, 13th April
item.description:
The whole of Priors road from Cromwell road to Prestbury road looks like artillery has been bombarding it. Cars are swerving all over the place to avoid the potholes. This road needs completely digging up and starting from scratch
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sinking pavement into my front garden., 13th April
item.description:
I believe this is collapsing due to the drainage under the pavement outside my house. Red Barriers have been put up, with the case now closed. If this is not being taken any other further, can the barriers be collected asap please? The subsiding pavement is nothing to do with 1 great western terrace and that if GCC. Please update, as it’s been months with barriers outside my house now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Great Western Terrace, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked storm drain, 13th April
item.description:
The drain in front of the driveway at 1 Yew Tree Close, Shipton Oliffe is blocked. It floods whenever it rains and runs into the driveway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Yewtrees, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recently repaired pothole now subsiding, 13th April
item.description:
Recently repaired pothole now subsiding, next to the end of the layby, Golden Valley A40, eastbound, towards Cheltenham. Might be missing a sealant line around it ?? Could it be investigated and repaired (again) please ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Traffic light sequence out of sync, 13th April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Narrow pavement and tree root damaga, 13th April
item.description:

item.title: Many potholes in the pavement, 13th April
item.description:
Outside 4 larkhay road - on the other side of our front wall - there are so many pot holes running all the way along the other side of our wall- many have some earth in them or they would be very dangerous, but the tarmac is breaking up in many place leaving deep holes and if there is earth in the potholes they become full of weeds. This has been an issue for the past 3 years - but the tarmac is now breaking up more each year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larkhay Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Priors Road heavily rutted and desperately needs resurfacing, 12th April
item.description:
Could someone explain to me why Glos Highways are seemingly doing NOTHING to remedy the atrocious state of the road? What do your Highways inspectors actually do? Appalling - Glos Highways should be ashamed of what they are ignoring and in turn placing road users lives at risk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chiltern Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights from A417, 12th April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
